Tutorials¶

This section is a tutorial on how to use the library. The tutorial shows how to use the basic functions and classes to get something – usually very simple – done. The goal is not to show the power of the library (consult the Demos for those), but to help learn to do things using computational intelligence.

Most of the source code to the tutorials can be found in a directory in your Peach package. Search for the tutorials directory in the package you download, the tutorials will be there. They are, usually, very well comented and described, but if you may feel that they are not, please write to us. And if you write a nice program that you think that could be in the tutorial page, write to us too

Tutorials on Neural Networks:

  • Basic Neural Network Manipulation
  • Using Custom Activation Functions
  • Mapping of a Plane
  • The XOR Problem
  • Linear Prediction of a Number Sequence
  • Interpolation of a Number Sequence
  • Polynomial Regression
  • Basic Self-Organizing Maps
  • Extended Example on Self-Organizing Maps
  • Hopfield Model
  • K-Means Clustering

Tutorials on Fuzzy Logic:

  • Fuzzy Sets
  • Using Membership Functions
  • Using Custom Membership Functions
  • Norms and Conorms
  • Defuzzification
  • Defuzzification is not the Complementary Operation of Fuzzification
  • Simple Controller
  • Generating a Control Surface
  • Fuzzy C-Means

Tutorials on single and multivariable Optimization:

  • Linear Optimization of a Single Variable
  • Linear Optimization of a Single Variable with Derivative Methods
  • Optimization of a Multivariate Function
  • Optimization of a Multivariate Function by Quasi-Newton Methods

Tutorials on Simulated Annealing:

  • Optimization by Simulated Annealing
  • Using Custom Neighbor Functions
  • Optimization by Binary Simulated Annealing
  • Dealing with Binary Objective Functions

Tutorials on Particle Swarm Optimization:

  • Optimization by Particle Swarms

Tutorials on Genetic Algorithms:

  • Dealing with Binary Objective Functions
